content:
Today I chose issue 1142 for discussion!

Etale cohomology
Created by @Kevin Buzzard (@kbuzzard) on 2019-06-21
Labels: feature-request, long term

Is this issue still relevant? Any recent updates? Anyone making progress?

This will happen, in time. Right now I've realised that there are actually two distinct things going on here: first we need some commutative algebra, plus its application to scheme theory, and then essentially independent of that we need some homological algebra, which is being actively worked on right now by Scott and Markus.

Today I chose issue 1142 for discussion!

Etale cohomology
Created by @Kevin Buzzard (@kbuzzard) on 2019-06-21
Labels: long term, feature-request

Is this issue still relevant? Any recent updates? Anyone making progress?
Yes still relevant, still a long term feature request

Have you seen this? https://arxiv.org/abs/2202.05875

This could give us a shortcut in formalizing the pro-etale site.

Invoking theorem 1 of a paper by Gabber is a bit scary. No I'd not seen this though! Ideally we'd get an expert in this area who knows about recent developments to give us a roadmap. Is that you Adam?

Today I chose issue 1142 for discussion!

So far I have managed to get funding for an AIM workshop in 2024 on algebraic geometry, and I was planning on working on this then (in Lean 4 of course)
